Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Seattle Children's (Seattle, WA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was emailed about coming in for an interview.  When I turned up for the interview I talked with the PI for about 30 minutes.  Some of the locations are tricky, so make sure to ask for detailed instructions as their website is not specific enough.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Family Service Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Seattle Children's in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Did a phone interview.  The hiring manager did not know the hours for the position and did not know the pay scale.  I applied for a part-time position that was supposed to be Monday - Thursday.  During the interview she said the position was Monday - Friday.  I told her that I applied for a part-time position.  She replied that she had decided to change the position to full-time.  She should had let me know about this to see if I would still be interested in the position.

She scheduled an interview with me.  I had to have unplanned minor surgery the day before my interview.  I had to cancel the interview due to doctors orders.  I asked if we could reschedule for the day after the day of the originally scheduled interview.  The hiring manager was unwilling to reschedule.
Interview Questions: Give an example of self starting.

title: Research Associate I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Seattle Children's (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: 3 people in panel interview. Very informal. Asked me what I had done in my previous lab. Looked over resume, and asked me some questions from it. Interview lasted like 20 minutes. I was hired 3 days later.
Interview Questions: What type of flow cytometry did you perform?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Seattle Children's (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: They contacted me quickly after applying to set up an interview. I met with a few different groups of people including potential coworkers with same job title, administrative managers, etc in a group setting. People were friendly and interesting to talk with. They wanted to know my technical skills in Microsoft Office and writing skills. They asked a long list of standard interview questions. There were two in-person interviews and follow-up questions by phone. Not much orientation to the larger hospital - was kind of left on my own to figure out where everything was.
Interview Questions: What is your definition of customer service?

title: Family Service Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Seattle Children's (Seattle, WA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my application and got a response abput a month later. They brought me in for an interview which took about 15-20 minutes. Then called me a week later to offer the job! Great experience and very straight forward. The questions tend to be based off the ART standards. This is accountability, Respect, and teamwork. So be sure to have some examples ready!
Interview Questions: How do you feel you relate to our ART standards? (Accountability, Respect, Teamwork)

title: Family Service Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Seattle Children's (Seattle, WA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening and in-person panel interview. A series of basic situational questions, mainly around team work and customer service. Then I had a few minutes to observe with someone already doing the job.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you saw a coworker making an error?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Seattle Children's
Interview Descriptions: Brief phone interview with only general questions. Upon learning about my experience as an undergraduate in a plant biology lab they asked if I knew anything about human biology. despite my repeated assurances that i was well versed in human biology, from that point on they seemed unhappy with my answers. It also seemed like the phone interview was the first time they were actually looking at my resume.
Interview Questions: give an example of time management

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Seattle Children's
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview then In Person Interview. They gave a tour of the research facility during the in-person interview. Said they would call within a week but did not get a notice until over a month later.
Interview Questions: Asked about past experience and education.

title: Health Promotion Specialist Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Seattle Children's
Interview Descriptions: Was in the system at SCRI as an intern and applied internally. Process was done in less than a week; drug test was required within 10-14 days or so of accepting job offer. Helps if you have someone you know already in the system to refer you - networking is highly recommended.
Interview Questions: No difficult or unexpected questions.

title: Credentialing Data Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Seattle Children's
Interview Descriptions:
Very typical - phone interview. one inperson interview and an offer the next day. Questions were standard. lots of 'please give us an example when you...' types of questions.
Nothing out of the ordinary.
Interview Questions:
Second interview was with a small panel. this was not difficult but was not expected.
in the time that i have been here i have seen many people hired. its seems like on average the process taken much longer then what i experianced.

title: Social Work Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Seattle Children's (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by phone by department manager for initial discussion on job and if it was an interest.  Scheduled for an informal phone interview with manager thereafter.  Then met for two separate panel style interviews within the department and team. Received a call back about a week later with the job offer.
Interview Questions: What does diversity mean to you; applied to your work?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Seattle Children's
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, in-person interview
Interview Questions: Nothing unexpected

title: Principal Investigator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Seattle Children's (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: My interview began when a division chief asked: "how hold are you and how large is your family".  A week before I was to start, $150K had mysteriously disappeared. Peers around my hiring manager didn't know a new faculty member was being onboarded.
Interview Questions: Describe where your successful NIH-funded research program will be in 5 years.

title: Clinical Research Associate I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Seattle Children's
Interview Descriptions: Did not have a phone interview. I was called for an in-person interview. It was very laid back and casual. They said they will inform me if I am selected for the next round. Haven't heard from since then.
Interview Questions: Questions were very casual and related to my past work experience

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Seattle Children's
Interview Descriptions: After applying, I received a phone call from HR to schedule an interview. The first part was a peer-interview, where I met 5 current RNs and the unit educator and they asked me fairly standard interview questions. This was intimidating, but overall beneficial because I could get a sense right away if I would enjoy working on the unit. After the 45 minute peer interview, I had a one-on-one interview with the unit manager, who explained more of what the position entails and asked me more standard interview questions. I then waited for about a week before receiving a phone call with a job offer.
Interview Questions: Most of the questions were very basic interview questions. During the peer interview I was asked, "what would you do if a family complained to you about another nurse?", and also "tell me about a time you were involved in a conflict with a peer and how did you handle it?". Those types of questions were expected, but can be difficult to answer if you don't have a specific experience in mind to talk about.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Seattle Children's (Seattle, WA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty standard.  I applied via company's website and got a call from the hiring manager for an in-person interview. I did not have a HR interview.
Interview Questions: Questions were targeted at past experience and behavioral questions. Nothing different from other standard interviews.

title: Surgery Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Seattle Children's (Seattle, WA) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview followed by in-person interview with department supervisor and manager
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Seattle Children's (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: I first had a phone interview with one of the recruiters then I was invited to a group/panel style interview that lasted about an hour. After this process I was called in to do a 1:1 with each person I would be supporting. Nice people, committed to the hospital's mission. The environment is really positive and the people are genuine.
Interview Questions: NONE, standard questions

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Seattle Children's (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions:
The interview went well with lots of questions about past work experience. I could tell the hiring manager was strict and unfriendly but very brilliant. I received a short tour of the floor I would be working on but did not meet anyone else. 

The onboarding process was awful. I sat with an individual from HR for about 10 minutes who explained the benefits and that was it. My boss did nothing either. I felt very lost for the first 6 or so months trying to learn everything on my own.
Interview Questions: Are you planning on leaving for Medical School? If so please don't accept this position.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Seattle Children's (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview; interview loop with 5 individuals
Interview Questions: What's the last business book you've read?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Seattle Children's (Seattle, WA) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Met with hiring manager. One on one interview. Q & A. Very pleasant. Answered all my questions.
Interview Questions: Describe an experience that did not go as planned and how did you react?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Seattle Children's (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Manager wasn't even present for the interview. The two girls who interviewed me were younger and seemed nice enough. They said they would make a decision in a week but then NEVER called me again. I left a VM to follow up and still never got a call back. I was a intern at another unit at Children's and to not even get a stock rejection email or letter is completely unprofessional (and hurtful) in my opinion. The interview itself was pretty easy (name a time you made a mistake and what did you do to fix it, etc.). I just don't appreciate at all that they never bothered to let me know that I didn't get the job, especially since I actually turned down another job offer just so I could interview there. Overall I was disappointed in the way this was handled.
Interview Questions: Name a situation where you made a mistake at work. How did you fix it.

title: Clinical Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Seattle Children's (Seattle, WA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Calm, not intimidating, fair, relaxed. I was in a conference room with my future supervisor, she was warm and welcoming. She asked fair questions about my experience, my goals in life, etc. It was pretty average as far as interviews go.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Learning & Development Administrative Specialist Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Seattle Children's (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed first with the hiring manager.  It was a very informative interview for me, while the discussion offered excellent opportunities for me to discuss my qualifications and how I could benefit the organization.  A week later I was invited back for a group interview with the team.  This was a STAR style behavioral interview.  The team did a great job of questioning me on how I might work with them and what experiences I have that would benefit their department.
Interview Questions: What was the most difficult coaching experience you had involving a negative behavior?

title: Senior Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Seattle Children's in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: When I originally started: Apply online, MUST include a cover letter or they won't even look at it. Match key words, first round of resume filters is done by computer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Psychometrist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Seattle Children's (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: I circumvented HR and got the job.  I applied online twice for the same position and never heard from HR.  So I researched who the senior clinicians in the department were and sent them individual cover letters and my resume for review. That got their attention and they contacted HR to contact me.  It took Seattle Children's 1 year to fill the permanent part-time position.  You will interview with Director of department, Business manager of department, senior psychometrists, and psychologists. They are looking for how well you can manage challenging pediatric population, previous experience with standardized measures.  You'll be required to commit to continual performance improvement, they'll list many things they want, but they don't pay for, such as Certified Psychometric Specialist certification which i got while at Children's but it made NO difference to my pay.  Similarly they want you to show engagement in continual education through affiliation with professional organizations.  Again, while this is desirable it is not rewarded in any way.  Negotiate your starting salary, DO NOT accept the lowest end of your pay scale because it won't increase significantly over time no matter what you do.  Don't accept that this is just how 'non-for-profit' organizations work, because that's only how they work at levels that are unimportant to them.
Interview Questions: Make sure you are familiar with measures such as WISC-IV, WAIS-IV, WIAT-III, NEPSY, DKEFS, Teach, RCFT, WMS-IV,

title: Administrative Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Seattle Children's (Seattle, WA) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: The first round interview was with the direct supervisor.  I was able to get a broad description of the job and a understanding of the department's values and work environment.  The second round of interviews were with the Director, other Admin (sharing the office) and the 2 managers I would be supporting.  I got a greater understanding of the day to day activity, the group dynamic and the culture.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with difficult coworkers?
